sect1.title: svn update/up
sect1.para: svn update or svn up. This command syncs your local working copy with the server and is probably, along with svn commit the command you will use most frequently. If you have made local changes, it'll try and merge any changes on the server with your changes on your machine. You should always do a manual svn update before trying to commit changes in order to check that everything is alright and ready to go (although when you do a svn commit, it will warn you if there is a problem).
